Package Pieces

Class Piece

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pieces.Piece
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
    public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
    Piece defines an abstract class that is implemented by different kinds of chess pieces. This abstract class defines 14 methods that are vital to the chess game. .
    Author:
    Osama Syed, Arbaz Pathan

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field Description
      java.lang.String color
      String color keeps track of the color of the piece.

      Integer that keeps track of number of moves.

      String current position keeps track of the position of the piece.
      boolean epAvail
      Boolean that keeps track if enPassant is available for a piece.

    • Field Detail

      • color

        public java.lang.String color
        String color keeps track of the color of the piece.

      • currentPosition

        public java.lang.String currentPosition
        String current position keeps track of the position of the piece.

      • count

        public int count
        Integer that keeps track of number of moves.

      • epAvail

        public boolean epAvail
        Boolean that keeps track if enPassant is available for a piece. It is only set true in the Pawn class if a player moves their Pawn 2 spaces on its first turn. It is later set to false after the opponent has made a move.

    • Method Detail

      • moveValid

        public abstract boolean moveValid​(Piece[][] board,
                                  java.lang.String oldPos,
                                  java.lang.String newPos,
                                  java.lang.Boolean white)
        Method to check if the move done is valid.
        Parameters:
        board - the current playing board
        oldPos - of the piece attempting to move
        newPos - of the piece attempting to move
        white - if the piece is white or not
        Returns:
        returns a boolean, whether or not the move made was valid

      • toString

        public abstract java.lang.String toString()
        String method to convert to a String.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • getColor

        public java.lang.String getColor()
        A method that returns the color of a current piece.
        Returns:
        a string corresponding to the color of the piece.

      • getCol

        public static int getCol​(java.lang.String position)
        A method that returns the column of a piece given its position.
        Parameters:
        position - current position
        Returns:
        an string corresponding to number of moves.

      • getRow

        public static int getRow​(java.lang.String position)
        A method that returns the what row a piece is at given its position.
        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • attackingOwnPiece

        public static boolean attackingOwnPiece​(Piece[][] board,
                                        java.lang.String oldPos,
                                        java.lang.String newPos)
        A boolean method that returns if a piece is attacking its own color. True if it is, and the move is illegal, false otherwise.
        Parameters:
        board - the current board
        oldPos - the old position of the piece attempting to move
        newPos - the new position of the piece attempting to move
        Returns:
        an boolean if the piece is attacking its own color or not.

      • movingOwnPiece

        public boolean movingOwnPiece​(java.lang.Boolean whiteTurn)
        A boolean method that returns if a player is attempting to move its own piece or the other players piece, which would not be allowed.
        Parameters:
        whiteTurn - true if it is white's turn false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the piece is attacking its own piece.

      • move

        public static void move​(Piece[][] board,
                        java.lang.String oldPos,
                        java.lang.String newPos)
        A method to actually move a players piece.
        Parameters:
        board - the current board
        oldPos - the old position of a piece attempting to move
        newPos - position the new position of a piece attempting to move

      • updateHashmaps

        public static void updateHashmaps​(Piece[][] board,
                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> whitePieces,
                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> blackPieces)
        Method that updates both of the hashmap of piece locations based on the board.
        Parameters:
        board - the current playing board
        whitePieces - all of the white pieces remaining
        blackPieces - all of the black pieces remaining

      • kingChecked

        public static boolean kingChecked​(Piece[][] board,
                                  java.lang.String kingPosition,
                                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> attackingPieces,
                                  boolean whiteTurn)
        Method that checks whether or not the kings in check
        Parameters:
        board - the current playing board
        kingPosition - the position of the king
        attackingPieces - that are left that are the opposite color of the king
        whiteTurn - tracking which players turn it is
        Returns:
        returns true if king is checked.

      • whiteCheckMate

        public static int whiteCheckMate​(Piece[][] board,
                                 java.lang.String piecePosition,
                                 java.lang.String wkPosition,
                                 java.lang.String bkPosition,
                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> blackPieces,
                                 java.lang.Boolean whiteTurn)
        Method that test whether or not the White King is in Checkmate, it does this by calculating the number of moves that a players piece can make to save its king.
        Parameters:
        board - the current playing board
        piecePosition - the position of the piece which is being checked to see if it can save the king
        wkPosition - of the White King
        bkPosition - of the Black King
        blackPieces - all the black pieces remaining
        whiteTurn - tracking which players turn it is
        Returns:
        returns the number of moves the piece can make to save the king.

      • blackCheckMate

        public static int blackCheckMate​(Piece[][] board,
                                 java.lang.String piecePosition,
                                 java.lang.String wkPosition,
                                 java.lang.String bkPosition,
                                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​java.lang.String> whitePieces,
                                 java.lang.Boolean whiteTurn)
        Method that test whether or not the Black King is in Checkmate, it does this by calculating the number of moves that a players piece can make to save its king.
        Parameters:
        board - the current playing board
        piecePosition - the position of the piece which is being checked to see if it can save the king
        wkPosition - of the White King
        bkPosition - of the Black King
        whitePieces - all the white pieces remaining
        whiteTurn - tracking which players turn it is
        Returns:
        returns the number of moves the piece can make to save the king.

      • pawnPromotion

        public static void pawnPromotion​(Piece[][] board,
                                 Piece currentPiece,
                                 java.lang.String nextMove,
                                 java.lang.Boolean whiteTurn)
        Method that checks if the pawn has made it to the opposite side thus making it into a new piece.
        Parameters:
        board - the current playing board
        currentPiece - the current pawn
        nextMove - the next implemented by the user
        whiteTurn - tracking which players turn it is
